result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Saul Hernandez Martinez

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 25, 2023 at 10:00 am.

1:19 PM Defendant Saul Hernandez Martinez in court.  Attorney Luis C Cuevas in court for Saul Hernandez Martinez.  Prosecuting attorney Frank John Remington in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defn requests plea/sentencing, notice given to Defn in court.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 25, 2023 at 10:00 am.
10:59 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Luis C Cuevas.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defn requests STC, notice given to Defn in court.
Status conference on October 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Defn's notice for pre-trial conference 7/7/22 returned; unable to forward
Pre-trial conference on July 7, 2022 at 10:45 am.
01:46 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Luis C Cuevas.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defn requests another PTC, notice given to Defn in court.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
08:48 AM Defendant appeared.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. SPD still hasn't appointed, notice givent to Defn in court.
Status conference on March 23, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
Trial Judge - Br 12 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

11:13 AM Defendant appeared.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jim Larson duly sworn & interpreted. All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  The defendant will need an interpreter for future court appearances. Court confirmed 3/23/2022 hearing with defendant.  Status conference scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 08:45 am.
